segments.text: This is absolutely ridiculous; I'm getting quite agitated just watching.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: How can that woman possibly not hear the running water or feel it on her foot?
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: It's pouring out of the sink!
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: Her level of detachment is frankly astonishing and quite irritating.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: And those kids, climbing for cookies, knowing full well they shouldn't.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The boy is going to break his neck on that unstable stool.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: It makes me so frustrated to see such avoidable hazards being ignored.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: They are going to flood the entire kitchen, causing so much damage.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: And probably someone will get hurt in the process.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: Why doesn't anyone pay attention to anything anymore?
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The casual disregard for safety and property is just infuriating.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I want to march in there and turn off that faucet myself!
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: This whole situation is making my blood boil.
segments.speaker: PAR
